description: Doesn't work at all

brilliant edit
editor

The single star rating is for the snap not the application itself which I didn't test. Read on.

The app fails to start and issues the follwing error when launched from the commandline:

This application failed to start because it could not find or load the Qt platform plugin "wayland-egl"

A quick research on the internet found as the only solution to launch it with:

DISABLE_WAYLAND=1 notepadqq

If this is really the only option to fix the problem it should be included when installing the snap. So it looks like the snap version of notepadqq is not very well maintained. :-(
It can not find the installed printer.
This Snap does not include GLIBC which causes the app to crash.
Just doesn't work. I could probably diagnose in the terminal, but I don't want to. It should work, or it shouldn't be in the app store. Don't bother with it.
Why is this garbage listed when it doesn't work on a fresh LTS install?
This app could view the files and folders in the /media directory. Useless!
installed no errors, tried to open but get nothing. reinstall and same issue.
Installed, but it won't launch.  Uninstalled
No text cursor and unable to edit any opened files. Most of UI is unresponsive including tab close buttons.

at first glance, this seems to be a nice port of notepad++.
...then you notice instantly notice that it's gone stagnant compared to the constantly updating original, looking a few updates older. looking at the github, you notice it hasn't updated in *3 years*, save for a few bug fixes *a year ago*
...and how surprisingly frequently it crashes. like, *once every one or two days* sometimes.
...and that, apparently, instead of using a cache file like npp, it's silently in the background, eating ram even when not in use (and doing god knows what else according to the other reviews)

i so badly want this to be a good port, but i can just barely scrach 3/5 stars for being even remotely close to what it should be.

tl;dr- "i want to be able to use this, but the present is bleak and in afraid it doesnt have a future"
See summary. Unacceptable.

description: Read all of the reviews and calculated the odds that this thing would work right versus this thing sucking, and I went ahead and installed it anyway. Not sure what I was expecting. Hung up trying to open a LUA file and crashed. Removed.

We've been using Notepad++ and Notepadpp on Windows and Linux for as long as they exist; in our dev studio it's de-facto standard for both code and text editing. It is well-thought, with very useful feature of switching syntax highlighting pattern to any given language\dialect on-the-go. Absolutely must have software and can easily replace any "included" linux text editor.
summary: A great *nix port of all-time classic Notepad++

description: im a simple note user , one of my friend recomend me to use qq.

for me it's the perfect notepad++ replacement as I switched to linux. I had notepad++ run with wine, but it didn't recognise tabs for search and replace and some other stuff wasn't quite working as I wanted it. So the native app Notepadqq does it all perfectly!! Great job, very happy I found this 
The only thing I'm really missing here is the file comparison addon I'm using this a lot to compare especially sql files but I'm sure i find something for linux for this as well.

The app "works", the problem is it doesn't recognize the owner of the files or the permissions given to them. If I want to mod a file in my home folder, and it's a file I can mod as much as I want with text or gedit, with NPQQ I have to first move it to another folder, mod it there, and copy it back to where I need it. To much of a hassle for an app I hoped it would help me be more organized with it's colors. If this doesn't bother you, then the app is awesome.
